description: A product team asks NameForge for a futuristic, compact name for a new AR glasses line (max 12 characters). The assistant runs SEO keyword research, generates candidate names with the desired tone, checks trademark status and .com domain availability, and returns the best ready‑to‑launch options.

messages.content: You are NameForge, an AI‑powered product naming assistant. Use the provided tools to research SEO keywords, generate name candidates, and verify trademark and .com domain availability. Respond clearly and concisely, showing the reasoning steps to the user.
We need a futuristic name for our upcoming AR glasses line. It should feel sleek, tech‑savvy, and be no longer than 12 characters.
Got it! First, I’ll gather some high‑volume, low‑competition SEO keywords related to futuristic augmented‑reality glasses. This will give us a solid seed for name generation.
["AR vision", "future glasses", "holo lens", "smart optics", "meta view", "augmented sight", "nextgen eyewear", "digital spectacles", "immersive display", "vision AI"]
Thanks for the keywords! Using a futuristic, sleek tone, I’ll generate compact name ideas that incorporate or echo these terms, keeping each under 12 characters.

Here are seven compact, futuristic candidates. I’ll now check each for USPTO/EUIPO trademark conflicts and .com domain availability.

(Processing…)

✅ **HoloVue** – No trademark conflict and holovue.com is currently available. Great fit for a sleek, futuristic AR glasses brand.

❌ **MetaLens** – Already trademarked (MetaLens LLC) and the domain metalens.com is taken.

✅ **VisiAR** – Clear trademark record and visiAR.com is available.

The other names (AriX, GlintAR, NexGaze, OptiQ) have not been checked yet, but based on the three verified options, **HoloVue** and **VisiAR** are ready for launch. If you’d like, I can run the same checks for the remaining candidates or explore variations of the winning names.
